articles.title: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung seeks 'new phase' in ties with China at Xi Jinping meeting - BBC
articles.description: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung snapped selfies with China's Xi Jinping as he pursues better ties with China in a four-day visit.

articles.title: Magnitude 6.2 quake hits Shimane Prefecture - The Japan Times
articles.description: The initial jolt was a magnitude 6.2 quake that measured strong 5 on Japan's seismic intensity scale. There was no threat of a tsunami.

articles.title: Trump suggests extended U.S. stay in Venezuela for oil operations - Axios
articles.description: Trump is signaling a longer-term U.S. presence in Venezuela after Maduro's capture.

articles.title: Ohio police release video of person of interest in killing of dentist and his wife - CBS News
articles.description: Investigators believe Spencer and Monique Tepe were fatally shot between 2 a.m. and 5 a.m. last Tuesday in their home located in the Near East Side neighborhood of downtown Columbus.

articles.title: Maxx Crosby addresses Pete Carroll’s firing - NBC Sports
articles.description: The Raiders, as expected, fired coach Pete Carroll on Monday.

articles.title: U.S. officials reveal new details on the covert operation to capture Maduro - CBS News
articles.description: Months of planning led to a covert operation that caught the Venezuelan leader completely off guard.

articles.title: Tony Dokoupil’s ‘CBS Evening News’ Debut Is an Inauspicious Sign of Where CBS News Is Headed - Variety
articles.description: Tony Dokoupil tripped up over transitions and bulldozed a health expert over vaccines

articles.title: Asus ROG’s next ally is Xreal, with 240Hz AR glasses coming in 2026 - The Verge
articles.description: Xreal and Asus announced the ROG Xreal R1 AR glasses at CES 2026. These gamer-focused glasses support USB-C video and include a dock with HDMI and DisplayPort.

articles.title: Nvidia unveils 'reasoning' AI technology for self-driving cars - BBC
articles.description: Nvidia is partnering with Mercedes-Benz to launch a driverless car powered by its 'Alpamayo' tech

articles.title: Trump has a list of demands for Venezuela’s new leader - Politico
articles.description: Delcy Rodriguez appears to be the linchpin in any US strategy that may emerge.

articles.title: What are flu rates in your state? Cases surge in 45 states, breaking records - NBC News
articles.description: Doctor visits for flu-like symptoms — fevers, sore throat, extreme fatigue and body aches — have hit the highest level in nearly 30 years, the CDC reported.

articles.title: A $400,000 profit on Maduro's capture raises insider trading questions on Polymarket - NPR
articles.description: Online sleuths have tried to uncover who placed a winning bet on the Venezuelan leader's arrest to no avail. Still, prediction market watchers say the bet appears suspicious.

articles.title: Scientists just got some ancient clues about future sea-level rise — and it’s bad news - The Washington Post
articles.description: Rock samples collected from the Greenland ice sheet’s Prudhoe Dome show it completely melted in the past 10,000 years — and could vanish again amid climate change.

articles.title: He was sentenced to death. Rob and Michele Reiner loved him like a son. - NBC News
articles.description: Nanon Williams was sent to death row for a murder he says he didn't commit. Decades later, through daily emails and prison calls, Rob and Michele Reiner became family.

articles.title: Big Oil doesn’t share Trump’s dream of making Venezuelan oil great again - CNN
articles.description: President Donald Trump may have made a major miscalculation about Venezuela’s oil.

articles.title: 3 child flu deaths reported in Massachusetts: "We are seeing children who are seriously ill" - CBS News
articles.description: Three children have died from the flu in Massachusetts so far this season, the Department of Public Health said Monday.

articles.title: Illinois influenza death: Flu-like illness activity at highest rate, linked to new Subclade K variant, IDPH, CDC say - ABC7 Chicago
articles.description: There have been at least 120,0000 hospitalizations so far, the CDC says.

articles.title: Hyundai plans 30,000 humanoid robots a year for factories by 2028 - Axios
articles.description: The company plans to mass-produce Atlas humanoids in Georgia, and put them to work alongside real humans to build cars.
